SENT.plain: Myotilin (MYOT) is a promising candidate gene for Vocal Cord and Pharyngeal Weakness with Distal Myopathy (VCPDM, also known as MPD2)
Located within the minimum VCPDM candidate interval, myotilin mutations also cause a similarly progressive and adult-onset muscle disease
We examined myotilin in VCPDM patients by sequence analysis, RT-PCR, Southern blotting, and western blotting
We detected no defects in the myotilin gene, transcript, or protein in VCPDM
We also report several useful SNPs and STRs for the analysis of myotilin in muscle diseases of suspected, yet unknown genetic origin
We conclude that MYOT mutations likely are not a cause of VCPDM
